DataElement.preferredName: Patient Antibody Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes and no indicator related to patient receiving treatment with an antibody, a substance that can directly kill specific tumor cells or stimulate the immune system to kill tumor cells, as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Antibody Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to patient receiving treatment with an antibody, a substance that can directly kill specific tumor cells or stimulate the immune system to kill tumor cells, as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Antibody Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Treatment with an antibody, a substance that can directly kill specific tumor cells or stimulate the immune system to kill tumor cells.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Treatment with injections of antibodies to directly destroy specific, usually cancerous, cells or to stimulate the immune system to destroy those cells.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: At least 12 weeks from comple
ReferenceDocuments.description: At least 12 weeks from completion of antibody therapy with anti-checkpoint antibodies, such as anti-CTLA4 and anti-PD1

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4 or experimental check point inhibitor such as anti-PD1

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: At least 8 weeks from completion of antibody therapy with anti-checkpoint antibodies (e.g., anti-CTLA4, anti-PD1, anti-PD-L1)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: At least 4 weeks from completion of antibody therapy with anti-checkpoint antibodies (e.g., anti-CTLA4 and anti-PD1, anti-PD-L1)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has it been a minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and > 6 weeks from the last dose to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: URCC21038
ReferenceDocuments.description: Be scheduled to receive anti-PD-1/-L1 ICI-containing therapy according to FDA labels or NCCN guidelines at Category 1 or 2A as standard of care treatment alone or in combination with co-treatments (including alternative ICIs)
